newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks end up on strong buying demand.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks end up on strong buying demand.

text.p: Sri Lankan stocks closed sharply higher on Monday on strong buying interest for the limited quantities os shares available for sale, brokers said.
The all share index continued its rise to end 26.8 points up at 747.8. Price gains led declines 55 to 11.
Development Finance rose 20 rupees to 295 rupees, Hayleys 14.25 to 236.25, National Development Bank 25 to 260 and Aitken Spence 9.75 to 160.
"Everyone's quite bullish. There was buying interest across the board," said Ajit Wanigasekera of Ceylinco Stock Brokers.
"But volumes were fairly thin because sellers were absent," Wanigasekera said.
Turnover, supported by 86,000 shares of Hayleys at 236 rupees and 10,300 of Development Finance at 295, was 82.5 million rupees.
"Though profit-taking has already set in, the lack of sellers is holding prices firm. Its a good sign for the market," Wanigasekera said.
"We feel no need to take profits immediately as we expect the market to climb to the latter half of the 700 range," said Gihan Rajapakse of CTC Eagle Fund Management.
